channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: South Korea says it has reached a deal with the US for the release of workers in a Georgia plant
item.description: More than 300 South Korean workers were detained in an immigration raid on Thursday. Presidential chief of staff Kang Hoon-sik said South Korea plans to send a charter plane to bring the workers home.
item.content:encoded:
More than 300 South Korean workers were detained in an immigration raid on Thursday. Presidential chief of staff Kang Hoon-sik said South Korea plans to send a charter plane to bring the workers home.

(Image credit: Corey Bullard)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The silent killer increases your risk of stroke and dementia. Here's how to control it
item.description: New recommendations for early treatment for hypertension to prevent strokes, heart attacks and dementia come as an experimental medication is shown to lower blood pressure in hard to treat patients.
item.content:encoded: New recommendations for early treatment for hypertension to prevent strokes, heart attacks and dementia come as an experimental medication is shown to lower blood pressure in hard to treat patients.
item.dc:creator: Allison Aubrey

item.title: Are you a grandparent-to-be? Here's some advice from those who came before you
item.description: Sept. 7 is National Grandparents Day. NPR readers shared the joys of becoming grandparents and offered some sage advice.
item.content:encoded: Sept. 7 is National Grandparents Day. NPR readers shared the joys of becoming grandparents and offered some sage advice.
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: Japan's Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba to resign
item.description: Japan's Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba has expressed his intention on Sunday to step down following growing calls from his party to take responsibility for a historic defeat in July's parliamentary election.
item.content:encoded:
Japan's Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba has expressed his intention on Sunday to step down following growing calls from his party to take responsibility for a historic defeat in July's parliamentary election.

(Image credit: Philip Fong)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Fantasy or faith? One company's AI-generated Bible content stirs controversy
item.description: "The AI Bible is a way to really bring these stories to life in a way that people have never seen before. Think of if we were like, the Marvel Universe of faith," said one of the site's creators.
item.content:encoded:
"The AI Bible is a way to really bring these stories to life in a way that people have never seen before. Think of if we were like, the Marvel Universe of faith," said one of the site's creators.

(Image credit: Courtesy Pray.com)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: A teen nicknamed 'God's influencer' has become the first millennial saint
item.description: Carlo Acutis, who died of leukemia at 15 in 2006, is known in the Catholic Church as "God's influencer" for harnessing technology to spread the word about miracles.
item.content:encoded:
Carlo Acutis, who died of leukemia at 15 in 2006, is known in the Catholic Church as "God's influencer" for harnessing technology to spread the word about miracles.

(Image credit: Valerio Muscella for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock

item.title: Russia assaults Ukraine with over 800 drones and decoys, the largest such attack in the war
item.description: Russia hit Ukraine's capital with drone and missiles Sunday in the largest aerial attack on the country since the war began.
item.content:encoded:
Russia hit Ukraine's capital with drone and missiles Sunday in the largest aerial attack on the country since the war began.

(Image credit: Evgeniy Maloletka)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Young Phillies fan is gifted swag after adult fan takes his home run ball
item.description: A boy in the stands of a Philadelphia Phillies game thought he'd scored a baseball hit by Phillies outfielder Harrison Bader, until another fan insisted the ball was hers.
item.content:encoded:
A boy in the stands of a Philadelphia Phillies game thought he'd scored a baseball hit by Phillies outfielder Harrison Bader, until another fan insisted the ball was hers.

(Image credit: Megan Briggs)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: They called him 'God's influencer,' the Catholic Church canonizes the first millennial saint
item.description: The Catholic Church is about to canonize its first saint of the millennial generation.
item.content:encoded: The Catholic Church is about to canonize its first saint of the millennial generation.
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock

item.title: Jim Jarmusch's 'Father Mother Sister Brother' wins top prize at Venice Film Festival
item.description: Jim Jarmusch's quietly humorous relationship triptych won the top prize on Saturday. The film about the relationships between siblings, and with their parents, stars Adam Driver, Vicky Krieps and Cate Blanchett.
item.content:encoded:
Jim Jarmusch's quietly humorous relationship triptych won the top prize on Saturday. The film about the relationships between siblings, and with their parents, stars Adam Driver, Vicky Krieps and Cate Blanchett.

(Image credit: Scott Garfitt)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
